metadata.title: CVE-2014-8418 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The DB dialplan function in Asterisk Open Source 1.8.x before 1.8.32, 11.xbefore 11.1.4.1, 12.x before 12.7.1, and 13.x before 13.0.1 and CertifiedAsterisk 1.8 before 1.8.28-cert8 and 11.6 before 11.6-cert8 allows remoteauthenticated users to gain privileges via a call from an externalprotocol, as demonstrated by the AMI protocol.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8418` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-config - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mobile - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-modules - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mysql - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-tests - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-vpb - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1').
